headline: BlackRock buys up Bitmine shares as Ethereum threatens to fall to $1,400 price
summary: Blackrock’s Bitmine share holdings jumped 166% in the fourth-quarter of 2025. CEO Larry Fink is bullish on tokenisation with the company citing Ethereum as the big winner.

content.title: BlackRock buys up Bitmine shares as Ethereum threatens to fall to $1,400 price
content.summary: Blackrock’s Bitmine share holdings jumped 166% in the fourth-quarter of 2025. CEO Larry Fink is bullish on tokenisation with the company citing Ethereum as the big winner.

thumbnail.caption: BlackRock is doubling down on Ethereum by buying up more Bitmine shares during the market dip, the firm disclosed on Thursday.  Illustration: Gwen P; Source: Shutterstock

headline: BlackRock Deepens Tokenization Push With BUIDL Trading And Uniswap Governance
summary: BlackRock (NYSE:BLK) has begun trading its tokenized U.S. Treasury fund, BUIDL, on Uniswap's decentralized finance platform. The firm has also purchased Uniswap's governance token, tying its asset management business directly into DeFi decision making. This move represents BlackRock's first direct use of decentralized finance trading infrastructure for a tokenized fund. BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, has been expanding its presence in digital assets. This step into DeFi...

headline: US Spot Bitcoin ETFs See $410M in Outflows as BTC Slips Below $66K

The institutional tap hasn’t just been turned off; it’s running in reverse.This marks the second straight day of ...

headline: BlackRock Signals $257M Bitcoin and Ethereum Sell-Off Ahead of Partial U.S. Government Shutdown
summary: BlackRock, the world’s largest asset manager, looks set to offload more Bitcoin and Ethereum, following the outflows from its crypto ETFs yesterday. This move comes ahead of another potential partial U.S. government shutdown that could begin tomorrow as today’s deadline looms. headline: BlackRock Increases Bitmine Stake to Over 9 Million Shares: What’s Next?
summary: If you think the institutional appetite for crypto ended with the ETF approvals, look again. In a move that signals massive long-term conviction, the world’s biggest asset manager, BlackRock, has reportedly increased its stake in Bitmine to over 9 million shares, according to a recent 13H-FR filing surfaced on X. ...
